result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Cases 22CF32, 22CF364, 22CF412, 22CF446, 22CF33, 22CF365, 22CF411 called at 8:34am 
Defendant Linda M. Adamczyk in court.  Attorney Francis P Raff in court for Linda M. Adamczyk.  
Defendant Jeremiah W Jacobs in court. Attorney Cassi Nelson in court for Jeremiah Jacobs. 
Attorney Theresa Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance.

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment occur in Cases 22CF364, 22CF412, 22CF446, 22CF365,22CF411:
Mr. Jacobs and Ms. Adamczyk waives their right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds both Defendants over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Informations admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

On State's Motion to Modify Bond in Case 22CF32(Adamczyk):
--Arguments given by ADA Beck
--Arguments given by Atty Raff

The Court modifies bond to $100 cash bond, with conditions to continue. 

recess: 8:55am
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (10/13) ML
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (10/13) ML
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (09/28) ML
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF33, 22CF365, 22CF411(Jacobs) and 22CF32, 22CF364, 22CF412(Adamczyk) called at 10:14am 
Defendant Jeremiah W Jacobs in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassi Nelson in court for Jeremiah W Jacobs.  
Defendant Linda M. Adamczyk in court, in custody. Attorney Francis Raff in court for Linda Adamczyk. 
Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

On Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond in Cases 22CF33 & 22CF365:
--Atty Raff joins in Atty Nelson's request to remove no contact prohibition of bond
--ADA Teuber opposes
--Additional arguments given by Atty Nelson and Atty Raff

The Court amends bonds to remove no contact condition and replace with a 'no discuss' condition. 

Atty Raff orally moves for reduction of cash bond; Court directs motion be filed. 
recess: 10:20am 
NEXT: As to Cases 22CF365, 22CF411, 22CF364, 22CF412, Preliminary Hearing on 10/21/22 at 8:15am
As to Cases 22CF33 & 22CF32, Status on 10/21/22 at 8:15am
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (08/22) ML
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ae] case called 12:55 PM Defendant Linda M. Adamczyk appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct and updates address
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge(*s) and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires a $1500 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with co-defendant
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--prints and photos at JCJ if not already done

recess 1:09 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Status Conference on 9/16/22 at 9:30 am
